column5: 7 Guys, 3 full days of fishing, Fri.Sat.Sun. 15 Walleye 2 Drum. Biggest Walleye was 8.8 lbs. We caught all our fish west of Keith's Shoal. Seems deep water held most fish. I think most fish were caught on a different lure. All deep runners. Stretch 20's, Tail Dancers, Fingerling's. 150 to 250 back behind boards. We got 1 fish straight off the back, flat line. Between the 2 boats, fish caught, was almost even. Everyone caught a fish, except one, and I'm not tellin  his face is not in the pictures  . Most fish released We fished 4 guys in my boat and 3 in the other, festival boat.  Ferry ride across      Dragging   fish to the boat.        My buddy with a stretch 20 that he stuck purple tape on the sides, caught the biggest, plus 2 fish on that same lure.  This was our other crew. Boat was won in the Perch Fest.          Don't you just hate it when it comes to an end of a good trip.   Were heading back for 4 days on the 25th. of Nov.
WOW great going, Almost beats Erie well almost..  Thanks for the pics  I can't wait 2 weeks to go.

Your right Lex 15 Walleye for 3 days 7 guys is not a big count. If it wasn't for enjoying the camaraderie with just getting away with friends. That drag a meat fishery down there wouldn't be my bag. Some times you don't know you got a fish on. Give me drifting or jigging any day. I think it's dragging that big trophy in is what keeps people going.
looks like a great time  I can't wait to get down there
Nice report!  Gotta get me down there soon....
Nice trip...I'm taking my boat deer hunting this year
Nice report, I'm with you, hate draggin in the fish.  Give me a jig head on the end of my rod anyday!
Great to see you got into them. It was a great weekend with sunday being the big day. Fish had the feed bad on big time!! I was looking for you but you were miles further down then me.
I agree. When you look down through the crystal clear water and see a 12-14 pounder at the end of your line...........WOW !!!!! Thanks for the report.Great job out there !

Great report and pics double F!!!  I understand about the comradery thing making it all worth it!... there's nothing better than getting together with a bunch of friends and going fishing!!!  .. and it is almost embarrassing when an old "trash fish" like a Sheepshead outfights the targeted species!  ... but hey!... y'all pulled in a few nice "dirty wet diapers" and had some good yuks I'm sure!!!
